text.0: come we have pressed the juice for thee o indra drink this soma here.
text.1: sit thou on this my sacred grass.
text.2: o indra let thy longmaned bays yoked by prayer bring thee hitherward.
text.3: give car and listen to our prayers.
text.4: we somabearing brahmans call thee somadrinker with thy friend.
text.6: come unto us who bring the juice come unto this our eulogy.
text.7: fairvisored drink thou of the juice.
text.8: i pour it down within thee so through all thy members let it spread.
text.9: take with thy tongue the pleasant drink.
text.10: sweet to thy body let it be delicious be the savoury juice.
text.11: sweet be the soma to thine heart.
text.12: like women let this somadraught invested with its robe approach.
text.13: o active indra close to thee.
text.14: indra transported with the juice vast in his bulk strong in his neck.
text.15: and stout arms smites the vṛtras down.
text.16: o indra go thou forward thou who rulest over all by might.
text.18: long be thy graspinghook wherewith thou givest ample wealth to him.
text.19: who sheds the juice and worships thee.
text.20: here indra is thy somadraught made pure upon the sacred grass.
text.21: run hither come and drink thereof.
text.22: famed for thy radiance worshipped well this juice is shed for thy delight.
text.24: to kundapayya grandsons son grandson of srngavrs to thee.
text.25: to him have i addressed my thought.
text.26: strong pillar thou lord of the home armour of somaofferers.
text.27: the drop of soma breaketh all the strongholds down and indra is the Ṛṣis friend.
text.28: holy prdikusanu winner of the spoil one eminent oer many men.
text.29: lead on the wild horse indra with his vigorous grasp forward to drink the soma juice.
